intro: Moussonia septentrionalis, commonly known as the northern moussonia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers that bloom during the rainy season. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a velvety texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in swampy or wetland habitats.
